resources.string: The Button that takes you to the learn Page
The Button that takes you to the Catergories Page
The Button that takes you to the Progress Page

1. Prompt - The goal of the puzzle is to complete the method so that the method fulfills the requirements put forth by the prompt. Read the prompt in order to find out information such as the objective of the puzzle, the return-type of your method, and an example.

2. Method Header - The only portion of the code the puzzle gives you is the method-header. One good strategy would be to read the method-header to figure out the return-type of the method and its parameters.
3. Your Code - Type in your code here, under the method header.
4. Submit - Click the submit button to compile and submit your code to be checked for correctness.

5. Your Results - If your code was unable to compile, your code has one or more errors. Here, the error(s) will be displayed. If your code compiled successfully, your results will show up here. Your results will consist of a table showing the input your method was tested with, the correct output, and your output. If the correct output and your output match, you\'re correct and that row will be green. If you\'re wrong, the row will show up red.
This changes the way in which the edited text looks in the puzzles (Lined or a basic android text box)
Displays server activities and outputs along with errors that normally would not be seen.
There was an issue with sign-in, please try again later.
